name: Pasta Primavera
description: A flexible vegetable-forward pasta dish. You can optionally add chicken, stock, or wine, but the core is fresh vegetables and pasta tossed together with a light sauce.
gist: Sauté vegetables in order of cook time, deglaze if needed, then toss with pasta and pasta water.
ingredients:
Any vegetables (favorites: zucchini, broccoli stalks, red onion, garlic; other options: snow peas, peppers, cherry or sundried tomatoes, kalamata olives, spinach, carrots, asparagus, Brussels sprouts, peas)
Any pasta (preferably chunky shapes like penne or rigatoni)
Lemon juice
Optional: stock or white wine for deglazing
Optional: parmesan cheese
steps:
1. Begin boiling water for the pasta.
2. Chop vegetables into roughly bite-sized pieces, adjusting for cooking time (shave or finely chop dense vegetables).
3. Heat a pan with some oil.
4. Add vegetables to the pan in order of longest cooking time first.
5. If vegetables start to stick or burn, reduce heat and deglaze with stock or wine (or use pasta water). Repeat as needed.
6. Once veggies are nearly done, boil the noodles, removing them 1–2 minutes before fully cooked.
7. Add garlic a few minutes before adding noodles, cooking lightly.
8. Toss the almost-cooked noodles into the pan with some pasta water.
9. Grate parmesan if using and toss, emulsifying with pasta water, oil, wine, or stock into a light sauce.
10. Finish with a squirt of lemon juice.
